userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

custodhist.p: Gift of Mrs. Catherine B. Steele, 1968-1972.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] General Frederick Steele Papers, M0191, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

chronitem.event: Born at Delhi, Delaware Co., N.Y. Son of Nathanial S. and descendent of John S., a founder of Hartford, Conn.
Appointed cadet at West Point.
Graduated from West Point; commissioned 2nd lieutenant, 2nd infantry.
Mexican War. In action at Ocalaca, Contreras, Churubusco, Molino del Rey and Chapultepec. Twice brevetted for gallant conduct (Contreras and Churubusco).
1st lieutenant, 2nd infantry.
Served in California.
Served in Minnesota, Nebraska and Kansas.
Captain, 2nd Infantry.
Major, 11th Infantry.
During 1st year of Civil War, commanded a brigade at Wilson's Creek and other operations in Missouri.
Colonel of 8th Iowa Infantry (Volunteers).
Brigadier General of Volunteers.
Arkansas campaign. Division commander of Curtis' Army of the Southwest.
Major General of Volunteers.
Division commander in XIII Army Corps in operations against Chickasaw Bluffs and Arkansas Post. (Jan. 11)
Division commander in XV Army Corps (Sherman's) in Vicksburg campaign.
In command of forces in Arkansas.
Capture of Little Rock.
Red River Campaign, capture of Camden, battle of Jenkin's Ferry.
Canby's campaign against Mobile, in command of forces in Alabama east of Mobile Bay.
Commanded Western District of Texas with headquarters at Brownsville on the Rio Grande.
Commanded Department of the Columbia.
Mustered out as Major General of Volunteers; promoted to Lt. Colonel in the regular army Aug. 26, 1863 and Colonel July 28, 1866.
Died in San Mateo, California.

did.unittitle: Series IA. Correspondence and papers of General Frederick Steele, 1845-1890.

scopecontent.p: Includes 1 folder of miscellany. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: 1819, Feb. 11Ester and Peter St. John to Mrs. John Steele
Correspondence 1819-1861.
1a. 1845, Sept. 9.FS & M. N. Steele to Em (Mrs. L.C. Steele). ALS. FS on furlough, murder of Osman Steele, FS starting with 40 men after chief Graham, family news.
1b. [1855?], Feb. 15.Mrs. Geo. Terrill to [F]S. AN. Invitation
2. 1855, Mar. 14.War Dept.-A.G.O. General Orders [G.O.] No. 3. Promotes FS to Capt. 2nd U. S. Infantry. True copy by Geo. D. Ruggles.
3. [1855?], May 4.Anna F. Parker to [F]S. ALS. Thank you note

4. 1858, July 28.Oscar L. Shafter, James McM. Shafter, T. W. Park, Solomon Heydenfeldt and Rensselaer E. Steele, Isaac C. Steele, George Steele, Edgar W. Steele. Indenture, DS. Lease of portion of Punta de los Reyes Ranch.
5. 1858, Aug. 1.George W. Cullum-printed circular. re: Register of the Officers and Graduates of the U. S. Military Academy.
6. 1858, Nov. 15.Dept. of the West. Special Orders [S.O.] No. 107. St. Louis, Mo. DS. Appointment of detail for court martial; s. D[on] C[arlos] Buell.
7. 1859, Feb. 12.N. S. Crowell. DS. Certificate of attendance at court martial.
8 & 9. 1859, Feb. 12.FS. 2 DSs. Printed and ms. forms for court martial service. Docket s. E. B. B. [Edwin Burr Babbitt?].
10. 1859, Sept. 4.Alex. Wilkin to FS. ALS. Re: payment of a debt.
11. 1859, Nov.Cameron Co., Texas - 12th Judicial District. Printed broadside. Report of the Grand Jury, On the Disturbances of the Country. A. B. Bacon, District Attorney.
12. 1860, Feb. 23.FS to E. W. Steele. ALS. Death of their mother.
13. 1861, Sept. 12Maj. Sturgis - Official report [8/20/61] of Battle of Wilson's Creek [8/10/61]. Clipping from The Republican, St. Louis.
14. 1861, Sept.FS - Official Report of Dug Spring Fight, etc. (8/2/61. Clipping.
15. 1861, Nov. 21.[FS] to Miss Anna [Parker?]. AL Re: Fremont's failure, Battle of Wilson's Creek, death of Gen. Lyon.
16. 1861, Dec. 31.A. Lincoln to Secretary of War [Stanton]. [Verifax?] of ALS. Recommends appointment of FS as Brigadier General of Volunteers with ANS of S[imon] C[ameron].
Correspondence 1862, January-March.
1. [1862], Jan. 3.Jno. Pope to FS. ALS. Sedalia orders, FS to be Brigadier General.
2. 1862, Jan. 8.Jno. Pope to FS. ALS. Military and personal.
3. 1862, Jan. 20.John B. Steele - The Slavery Question. Reprint of speech delivered in the U. S. House of Representatives.
4. 1862, Feb. 16.S. E. Meigs - Supply Invoice. DS.
5. 1862, Feb. 28.[Army] Headquarters, Cairo, Illinois. S.O. No. 20. DS. FS to report to St. Louis. Signed Geo. W. Cullum.
6. 1862, Feb. 28.Wm. Myers - List of supplies received by FS. DS.
7. 1862, Mar. 6.See No. 5 above.
8. 1862, Mar. 13.H. W. Halleck to FS. Tel.
9. 1862, Mar. [16].G. R. Dyer - Stores Receipt. DS.
10. [1862, Mar.?].Quarter Master's Stores - Monthly return.
Correspondence 1862, April-December.
186 1862, Apr. 7.G. [W.] [Sproule] - Stores receipt. DS.
2. 1862, Apr. 13.Edwin [U. Sheldon?]. to FS. ALS. Re: C. T. Scammon.
3. 1862, Apr. 14.G. [W. Sproule] - Stores receipt. D.S.
4. 1862, Jun. 22. Tratado de Extradicion entre los Estados-Unidos Mexicanos y los Estados-Unidos de America. Printed.
5. 1862, Sept. 1.O. L. Shafter et al to E. Steele et al. DS. Indenture-land lease for part of Puenta [sic] de los Reyes Ranch, Marin Co., California.
6. 1862, Nov. 1.[FS?] to General. ADf of letter. Maneuvers in Arkansas, military, politics.
7. [1862?,] Nov. 11.S. R. Curtis to FS. ANS. Extract from Blount [sic] (Blunt) to Schofield describing the Arkansas situation.
8. 1862, Nov. 11.G. A. Mitchell to [FS]. ALS.
9. 1862, Nov. 12.FS to Gen. Curtis. ALS. Rumors spread by rebels, Little Rock, etc.
10. 1862, Dec. 17.W. T. Sherman to FS. ALS. Organization of forces, Grant, Yazoo River area campaign plans.
11. 1862, Dec. 21.11th U. S. Infantry - Circular. DS. Re: regimental band. Signed G. N. Lieber.
12. 1862, Dec. 26.J. Horne, notary, et al. ADS. Re: FS's order surrendering fugitive slaves at Helena, [Arkansas] 9/4/62 and the circumstances of its execution.
13. [1862?].H. W. Halleck to FS. [ALS?]. Orders to move towards Salem and Gen. Curtis.
Correspondence 1863, January-June.
1. 1863, Jan. 22. Abraham Lincoln to FS. LS. FS's promotion. [Located in safe].
2a. [1863,] Jan 30.Ellen M. McClellan to FS. ALS. Wants autograph to auction at Sanitary Fair.
2, 3a & 3b. 1863, Feb. 15.[FS] to [A. Lincoln]. ADf and 2 unsigned (1 partial copy) copies. FS's defense to Forman's charges, conditions in Helena, fugitive slaves.
4. 1863, Feb. 22.John M. Thayer to [A. Lincoln]. ALS. Character witness for FS.
5. 1863, Apr. 11.Loyal Publication Society. Printed address. Read at inaugural meeting of the Loyal National League at the request of the League.
6. [1863,] May 1.Vicksburg, Miss, Holograph map by Juls. Pitzman. Shows Sherman's attack, FS's Division, Blair's Division, etc.
7. 1863, May 1-3. Near Chancellorsville. Holograph map of the battles by A. Pohlers.
8a. 1863, May 3.Irwin McDowell to FS. LS. Court of Inquiry re: traffic in cotton, etc.

8b. 1863, Mar. 17.A. Lincoln and E. M. Stanton. Copy of DS. Appointment of FS as Major General of Volunteers. Original owned by Wilfred Steele. Oversize. [Located in map drawer]. [Out of place, should follow #4.]
9. [1863, May].Jackson, [Miss.]. Pencil map indicating routes.
10. [1863, May].Jackson, [Miss.]. Pencil map with interesting notations.
11. [1863, May].Haines Bluff, [Miss.]. Holograph detail map.
12. [1863, May-July].Vicksburg, [Miss.] and Area. Holograph map by Juls. Pitzman. Many additions. Shows south to Port Gibson, north to Haines Bluff, west to Richmond, and east to Raymond.
13. 1863, June 9.A[lexander] D[allas] Bache to FS. LS. Re: operations map of Vicksburg.
14. [1863, June 9?].Louisiana 1855. Printed map with pencil notations indicating it was used at Vicksburg.
15. 1863, June 21.W. T. Sherman to FS. ALS. Thanks for present of Duke. [horse].
16. 1863, June 24.W. M. Voglison [sic]. ADS. Receipt for 44 cases of Sparkling Catawba Wine. NS of A. J. Smith.
17. 1863, June 28. To Our Friends in Vicksburg. Printed broadside. Propaganda
Correspondence 1863, July-August.
1. 1863, July 24.C[harles] E[dward] Hovey to FS. ALS. Re: appointment of Hovey.
3. [1863, July?]. Historical Sketch of the Rebellion. Printed map.
4. [1863, July].Vicksburg, [Miss.]. Printed map by U. S. Coast Survey Office, shows U. S. operations.
5. [1863, July?].[Vicksburg, Miss.]. Holograph map showing artillery, mortar and gunboat positions.
6. [1863, July].Yazoo, [Miss.]. Holograph map showing south to Vicksburg, north to Lake Bolivar, and west to Lake Providence.
7. 1863, Aug. 9.[FS] to J[ohn] W[ynn] Davidson. ADF Reports re: Arkansas, FS's career.
8. 1863, Aug. 11.[FS] to Unknown [Gen'l. _____?]. ADF Re: Davidson, military situation and plans, White River, Arkansas expedition.
9. [1863, Aug. 11].[DeValls Bluff, Ark.]. Holograph map.
10. 1863, Aug. 12.J. W. Paddock to FS. ALS.
11. 1863, Aug. 13.FS. ADS. Certifies remuneration claims.
12. 1863, Aug. 13.[FS] to Unknown [Gen. _____?]. ADF Plans re: Little Rock.
13. 1863, Aug. 21.C[harles] R[obert] Woods to FS. ALS. Re: horses.
14. 1863, Aug. 27.U. S. Grant to FS. ALS. Re: 3rd Iowa Cavalry..
Correspondence 1863, September.
1. 1863, Sept. 12.FS - Official Report of Operations in Arkansas. ADf.
2. 1863, Sept. 12.FS. Galley of #1.
3. 1863, Sept. 22.FS to J. M. Scofield. ALS. Supplementary report to that of 9/12. Operation against Little Rock.
4. 1863, Sept. 23.[FS] to H. W. Halleck. Unsigned copy.
5. 1863, Sept. 25.Edwin M. Stanton. Doc., stamped? Appointment of FS as Lt. Colonel in the 3rd U. S. Infantry.
6. 1863, Sept. 28.Frank P. Blair, Jr. to FS. ALS.
Correspondence 1863, October-November.
1a. 1863, Oct. 13.War Dept.-A.G.O. G. O. No. 336. Printed. Military commission, trials of Thomas Kane and Wm. McNellis.
1b. 1863, Oct. 16.Ella Steele to Edgar Steele. Xerox of ALS. Reference to FS.
2. 1863, Oct. 18.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 1. Printed. U. S. Grant takes command of Division. s. T. H. Harris.
3. 1863, Oct. 18.[FS] to J.[sic] M. Stanton. ADf. Recommends Col. Glover.
4. 1863, Oct. 19.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 2. Printed. Sherman to command Department and Army of the Tennessee. s. T. H. Harris.
5. 1863, Oct. 19.[FS] to J. M. Schofield. ADf.
6. 1863, Oct. 19.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 340. Printed. Proclamation by the President calling for 3000000 volunteers.
7. 1863, Oct. 19.War Department - A.G.O. G. O. 343. Printed. General court martial - Sam'l Ford.
8. 1863, Oct. 11.FS to J. M. Schofield. ALS.
9. 1863, Oct. 11.FS to S. A. Hurlbut. ALS.
10. 1863, Nov. [9].FS to J. Richmond. ADf. Re: guerrillas.
11. 1863, Nov. 9.[FS] to J. M. Schofield. ADf. Arkansas, troops, spies.
12. 1863, Nov. 9.[FS] to W. T. Sherman. ADf. to hold the Line of the Arkansas.
13. 1863, Nov. 12.Military Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 6. Printed. s. T. S. Bowers.
14. 1863, Nov. 18.FS to J. M. Schofield. ALS. Cavalry expedition to White River, Benton.
15. 1863, Nov. 23.J. W. Davidson to FS. ALS.
16. 1863, Nov. 24.Thos. W. Knox to [FS?]. ALS. Re: prisoner exchange.
Correspondence 1863, December.
1. 1863, Dec. 7.Unknown [not signed] to S. M. Breckenridge. Copy in holograph. Recommends plan of operations in Louisiana and Texas. Docket 12/26/63 s. J. C. Kelton.
2. 1863, Dec. 8.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 7. Printed. Telegram from Lincoln. s. T. S. Bowers.
3. 1863, Dec. 9.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 8. Printed.
4. 1863, Dec. 9.Miss M. S. Worth to FS. ALS. Citizens of Albany [N.Y.] propose to organize a fair and request FS's autograph.
5. 1863, Dec. 10.G. L. Miller to FS. ALS. FS's policy in Arkansas.
6. 1863, Dec. 11.J. M. Schofield to FS. ALS. Re: Banks, reinforcements.
7. 1863, Dec. 12.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 10. Printed. Policy re: Confederate deserters.
8. 1863, Dec. 12.[FS] to J. M. Schofield. ADf. Reason for scattered troops.
9. 1863, Dec. 15.Th. H. Yeatman to FS. LS.
10. 1863, Dec. 10.W. W. Wilshire. ADS. Receipt for tax on cotton, enclosed in #9.
11. 1863, Dec. 16.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 12. Printed. s. Geo. O. Sokalski.
12a. 1863, Dec. 18.Geo. B. Peters to FS. ALS.
12b. 1863, Dec. 22.C. E. Hovey to FS et al. ALS.
13. 1863, Dec. 23.Th. H. Yeatman to FS. LS. Application to ship cotton, fraud situation as seen by Treasury agent.
14. 1863, Dec. 29.T. T. Crittenden to [FS]. ALS.
15. 1863, Dec. 29.Th. H. Yeatman to FS. LS. More on cotton fraud.
16. 1863, Dec. 30.W. N. Hood to FS. ALS. Destruction of property, compansation.
17. 1863, Dec.Documents. Copies. Re: shipping cotton, permit.
18. [1863?].Vickaburg, [Miss.]. Clipping. Fragment of article.
19. [1863-64?].Thos. C. Anderson to FS. ALS. Requests permission to ship plantation supplies.
Correspondence 1864, January.
1. 1864, Jan. 2.J. G. Dunlap to C. T. Christensen. ANS. Referred and s. C. T. C. to FS.
2. 1864, Jan. 5.Abraham Lincoln to FS. LS. Re: Arkansas, oath, re-organization of state government. [Located in safe].
3. [1864], Jan. 7.E. W. [Gantt] to FS. ALS. Re: Arkansas, politics, personal.
4. 1864, Jan. 7.War Department - A.G.O. Printed request for military history. s. [Samuel] Breck.
5. 1864, Jan. 8.Harriet C. [Norrland] to FS. ALS. Plea for life of a Confederate soldier.
6. [1864], Jan. 8.H. C. Norrland et al to FS. ALS. Plea for life of spy.
7a. 1864, Jan. 8.FS to Ladies. ADf. Plea came too late.

7b. 1864, Jan. 11.U. S. Sanitary Commission, California Branch to Steele Brothers. Photo of certificate for $2,850 obtained for cheese. s. Henry W. Bellows, F. F. Low, R. G. Sneath and O. C. Wheeler. [Original belongs to donor].
8. 1864, Jan. 14.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Re: reviving slavery in Arkansas would require another revolution.
9. 1864, Jan. [17?].[FS] to Admiral D[avid] Porter. ADf. Shipping.
10. 1864, Jan. 18.War Department - A.G.O. Printed circular re: invalids.
11. 1864, Jan. 19.J[osiah] Snow and I[saac] C. Mills to FS. ALS. of Mills. Washington, D. C., Arkansas, Steeles.
12. 1864, Jan. 20.Abraham Lincoln to FS. LS. Arkansas petition for an election, agrees to. [Located in safe].
13. 1864, Jan. 20.Dosiah Snow to FS. ALS. Arkansas a separate department, FS commander.
14. 1864, Jan. 20.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Re: command of Arkansas, FS's support in Washington.
15. 1864, Jan. 21.S. A. Hurlbut to FS. ALS. Requests Brig. Gen. Kimball be ordered to report to him [S.A.H.]
16. 1864, Jan. 21.[FS] to I. Murphy. ADf. Aska opinion of his conciliatory policy.
17. 1864, Jan. 21.Convention of Delegates of The People of Arkansas to FS. ALS. by Sec. R. J. T. White.
17a. 1864, Jan. 22.E. Bexter to FS. ALS with NS by John Good. Introduction.
18. 1864, Jan. 22.Isaac Murphy to FS. ALS. Re: conciliatory policy in Arkansas.
19. 1864, Jan. 24.Jas. Harrison to FS. ALS. NS on docket by J. M. Schofield.
20. 1864, Jan. 26.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Advice, family, destroyed letters of FS re: Davidson.
21. 1864, Jan. 27.S. H. Boyd to F[S]. ALS. Re: Davidson, himself.
22. 1864, Jan. 27.Abraham Lincoln to FS. ALS. Private re: Gantt, Arkansas Convention, possible clash with Lincoln's policy. [Located in safe].
23. 1864, Jan. 30.Department of Arkansas. G.O.No. 1. Printed. Re: Department, command and 7th Army Corps.
24. 1864, Jan. 30.Abraham Lincoln to FS. ALS. Re: Arkansas, FS to use his judgement. [Located in safe].
25. 1864, Jan. 30.[FS] to T. H. Holmes. ADf. Communication with Confederate commander of Arkansas.
26. 1864, Jan. 31.Chas. H. Willson to [Edgar Steele?]. ALS. Return East from California.
27. [1864, Jan.].Mary Field Knapp et al to FS. ALS. Petition of the ladies of Little Rock for pardon of David O. Dodd, condemned to be hung as a spy.
28. [1864, Jan.?].Isaac Murphy to FS. ALS. Proposed order for propection of voters.
29. [1864, Jan.?].Wm. D. Snow. Printed broadside of an address with ANS on Verso to [FS].
30. [1864, Jan.?].[FS] to Unknown. Df. of letter of introduction
Correspondence 1864, February.
1. 1864, Feb. 1.J. W. Davidson to FS. ALS.
2. 1864, Feb. 1.FS to J. W. Davidson. ALS.
3. 1864, Feb. 2.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 2. Printed. Re: Proclamation Oath of Allegiance.
4. 1864, Feb. 2.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 2. Re: shipping horses and mules.
5. 1864, Feb. 2.FS to A. Lincoln. tel.S Re: date of Arkansas election.
6. 1864, Feb. 4.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 3. Printed.
7. 1864, Feb. 4.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 3. Printed. Re: manager of railways.
8. 1864, Feb. 4.FS to N. P. Banks. LS (part in FS's hand). Re: enemy forage stations, etc., possibly to move against Pine Bluff.
9. 1864, Feb. 4.War Department - A.G.O. Printed circular.
10. 1864, Feb. 6.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 4. Printed. Re: pilots.
11. 1864, Feb. 6.[FS] to H. W. Halleck. AL. Rebels arming.
12. 1864, Feb. 7.Department of Arkansas. G.O. No. 4. Printed.
13. 1864, Feb. 8.J. M. Johnson to I. Murphy. ALS. Re: President's desire to aid [Arkansas].
14. 1864, Feb. 9.R. P. Buckland to FS. LS. Enemy making preparations to attack Little Rock.
15. 1864, Feb. 10.Dept. of Arkansas.- Provost Marshall. G.O. No. 1. Printed.
16. 1864, Feb. 11.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Re: Sickles.
17. 1864, Feb. 12.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 5. Printed. Re: trade regulations.
18. 1864, Feb. 12.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Re: Sickles.
19. 1864, Feb. 13.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 5. Printed.
20. 1864, Feb. 13.FS to Loyal Case. ALS. Re: Mr. Merrick.
21. 1864, Feb. 13.War Department - A.G.O. Printed circular. Recruiting bounty.
22. 1864, Feb. 14.Edw. Bates to James Harrison. ALS. Pacification policies.
23. 1864, Feb. 14.Jos. R. Smith to [FS?]. ALS. Re: Hammond Court Martial, etc.
24. 1864, Feb. 15.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 6. Printed. Re: guard on steamboats.
25. 1864, Feb. 17.Department of Arkansas. G.O. No. 7. Printed Re: abandoned property.
26. [1864?], Feb. 17.M. Guthrie to FS. ALS. Asks favor.
27. 1864, Feb. 19.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 8. Printed.
28. 1864, Feb. 20.Isaac W. Arnold to [FS]. ALS. Asks intercession and protection of Col. Hartman.
29. 1864, Feb. 20.C. P. Bertrand to A. Lincoln. ALS. Re: Sickles.
30. 1864, Feb. 20.James Harrison to FS. ALS. Re: FS's military policy.
31. 1864, Feb. 20.Recruits (unassigned) to FS. ADS. Petition with ANS recommend of Isaac Murphy.
32. 1864, Feb. 23.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 9. Printed. Collecting and organizing negroes.
33. 1864, Feb. 25.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 6. Printed. Hiring negroes.
34. 1864, Feb. 25.[FS] to H. W. Halleck. L. Rebels in Arkansas, etc.
35. 1864, Feb. 25.J. B. Wheeler to FS. ALS.
36. [1864,?] Feb. 26.Mrs. Anderson to FS. ALS. Thank you.
37. 1864, Feb. 26.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 6. Printed. Same as that for Feb. 25.
38-39. 1864, Feb. 27.Mrs. E. Kirby Smith to FS. ALS and copy with AN.
40-41. 1864, Feb. 27.[FS] ADf. Announcing election in Arkansas and proclamation ADf.
42. 1864, Feb. 28.[FS] to N. P. Banks. AL. FS's troops, election, rebels line of defense - Red River.
43. 1864, Feb. 29.FS to People of Arkansas. DS. Proclamation re: election.
44. 1864, Feb. 29.FS - Proclamation. Printed version of #43, with election schedule.
45. 1864, Feb. 29.John M. Thayer to FS. ALS. Report re: Kansas Regiments in the Dept. of Arkansas, horses, forage, Ft. Smith.
46. 1864, Feb.Dept. of the Gulf. Map No. 14. Eastern and Central Texas. Printed on linen.
47. 1864, Feb.Maryland State Fair. Printed announcement. ANS of Mrs. Amos[Binney]on verso requesting autograph.
48. [1864, Feb.?].FS to Unknown [Fragment, 1st page missing]. Copy s. W. D. Green.
Correspondence 1864, March.
1. 1864, Mar. 1.A. I. Magill to FS. ALS. Request for mail from a rebel.
2. 1864, Mar. 2.Mrs. E. Miller to FS. ALS. Re: oath and purchasing.
3. 1864, Mar. 3.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 10. Printed. Wm. E. Woodruff, citizen - confederate takes oath to keep from starving.
4. 1864, Mar. 3.G. L. Miller to [FS]. ALS. Views on political and social aspect of Arkansas, FS.
5. 1864, Mar. 4.M. D. Lancey Landon to [FS]. ALS. Re: Gen. Buford.
6. 1864, Mar. 4.W. T. Sherman to FS. ALS and cover. Plans re: Shreveport movement, Tennessee.
7. 1864, Mar. 4.Fanny C. Woodruff and Mary C. Woodruff to FS. ALS. Ask to remain in Little Rock.
8. 1864, Mar. 5.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 11. Printed. Re: ordnance stores.
9. 1864, Mar. 5.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 12. Printed. Judge advocate.
10. 1864, Mar. 5.DeVall's Bluff, [Ark] to Memphis, [Tenn.]. Holograph map by M. M. Yeakle.
11. 1864, Mar. 5.Gray's Bridge [Ark?]. Holograph map, detail of #10.
12. 1864, Mar. 7.FS to N. P. Banks. Contemporary copy. Protect Arkansas polls, Gen. Price C.S.A. gone to Europe.
13. 1864, Mar. 7.Jane E. Woodruff to FS. ALS
14. 1864, Mar. 10.FS to J. Marmaduke. Contemporary copy s. W. D. Green. Re: treatment of prisoners.
15. 1864, Mar. 12.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 13. Printed. Military commission - trials.
16. 1864, Mar. 14. Information needed by the State of Arkansas Holograph document, unsigned. Re: U. S. Senators from Arkansas.
17. 1864, Mar. 16.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 15. Printed. General court martial.
18. 1864, Mar. 16.FS to C. C. Andrews. ALS. Re: interference in election.
19. 1864, Mar. 17.Headquarters, Armies of the U. S. G.O. No. 1. Printed. Appointment of U. S. Grant to command Armies of the U. S.

9. 1864, Oct. 24.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 275. Printed. Re: N. J. T. Dana.
10. 1864, Oct. 24.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 276. Printed. Volunteer Recruiting Service
11. 1864, Oct. 24.War Department - Ordnance Office. Letter stamped T. J. Treadwell. Re: returns.
12. 1864, Oct. 25.Dept. of Arkansas. S.O. No. 262. Printed, s. W. D. Green. Recall of Cavalry men on detached duty.
13. 1864, Oct. 25.War Department - Ordnance Office. Letter s. T. J. Treadwell. Similar to #11.
14. 1864, Oct. 26.B. O. Carr to FS. LS, [a true copy E. H.]. Herron's communication, denies charges. [Water damaged].
15. 1864, Oct. 26.Dept. of Arkansas. S.O. No. 263. Printed, s. W. D. Green, to C. T. Christensen. List of men detailed as clerks to Assistant Adjutant General's office.
16. 1864, Oct. 26.W. D. Green to J. M. Thayer. Copy of letter certified by W. D. Green. Orders return of enlisted men to 3rd Wisconsin Cavalry Volunteers.
17. 1864, Oct. 26.Joe A. Hughston to J. B. Steele. ALS. Nephew wants appointment to FS's staff.
18. 1864, Oct. 26.John S. Phelps to FS. ALS. Re: Price's movements, the Missouri Democrat (newspaper?), Banks' defeat.
19. 1864, Oct. 27.Thomas Baldwin to FS. ALS. Forny [sic] to move against Little Rock or Pine Bluff. Docket 10/28/64. NS of J. J. Reynolds.
20. 1864, Oct. 27.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 28. Printed, stamped M. Rochester. J. H. Wilson new chief of cavalry replacing R. W. Johnson.

21. 1864, Oct. 28.J. J. Reynolds (s. on docket) to FS. Forwards copy of John M. Crebs' report on reconnaissance to Gaines' Landing, dated 10/27/64.Rebels plan to move against Little Rock and Pine Bluff.
22. 1864, Oct. 28.FS to C.T. Christensen. LS. Forward S.O. No. 263, asks approval. Disapproved by C.T.C. 11/18/64.
23. 1864, Oct. 29.Division of West Mississippi. G.O. No. 65. Foreign exchange.
24. 1864, Oct. 29.Geo. H. McLoughlin to FS. ALS. Personal and requests appointment as acting aide on FS's staff.
25. 1864, Oct. 29.L. B. [Nash] to J. L. Chandler. ADS. Statement of the forces of the enemy serving in the Dept. of Arkansas. Forwarding ANS of J. L. Chandler to A.G.O.
26. 1864, Oct. 29.Mrs. [Caroline?] Scott to FS. AN. Sends ham of venison.
27. 1864, Oct. 29.FS to J. M. Thayer. Copy tel. s. W. D. Green. Instructions should Price come by Ft. Smith, sending subsistance stores, Magruder at Camden.
28. 1864, Oct. 30.C. C. Andrews to FS. ALS. Re: Devall's Bluff.
29. 1864, Oct. 30.Division of the Mississippi. G.O. No. 29. Printed, stamped M. Rochester. Re: Z. B. Tower, Inspector General of Fortifications in Division.

31. [1864, Oct.] Monthly Report of the Forces of the Enemy serving in the Departments of Arkansas and Missouri for the month of October 1864. s. J. L. Chandler.

1. 1864, Nov. 1.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 71. Printed. General court martial.

7. 1864, Nov. 4.Division of West Mississippi. G.O. No. 67. Printed. Rates of military transportation on Mississippi River and tributaries.

10. 1864, Nov. 7.F. N. Burke and Mary Eva Coolidge. Printed. [Wedding] announcement or invitation and cover.

22. 1864, Nov. 9.FS to E. R. S. Canby. Copy tel. s. W. D. Green. Rebel movements.
23. 1864, Nov. 10.Dept. of Arkansas. G.O. No. 75. Printed. Military commission.

33. [1865, Apr.].S. M. Eaton. DS. Rebel troops at Spanish Fort and Blakely.
34. [1865, Apr.].R. P. Strong. Signal message. 10 a.m. and 10:30 a.m. Steamers.
Maps [1865, April].Spanish Fort, Blakely, and Mobile.
1. Mobile-Blakely. North to New Wakefield and Choctaw Bluff. Hand executed.
2. Plan Shewing the Defences of Blakely. Hand executed.
3. Blakely and Mobile River. Many notations, torpedoes in Mobile Riber, etc. Hand executed.
4. In Front of Spanish Fort. North to Blakely and East to Hollyoke's. Hand executed.
5. In Front of Blakely. North to Choctaw Bluff and East to Perdido Station. Hand executed.

29. 1865, Jun. 29.District of Texas. S.O. No. 9, extract 2. s. F. W. Emery. Re: Joseph Rudolf.
30. 1865, Jun. 29.P. H. Sheridan to FS. NS. Brown not to deal with French.
31. 1865, Jun. 29.P. H. Sheridan to FS. NS. Hold steamer Compadri and cargo.
32. 1865, Jun. 29.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 119. Printed. Penalties.
33. 1865, Jun. 29.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 120. Printed. Whiskey rations no longer supplied.
Correspondence 1865, July.
1. 1865, Jul. 1.[J. G.?] French to FS. ALS. Letter from a Southern friend, animals taken from plantation, wants move.
2. 1865, Jul. 1.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 121. Printed. Medical directors.
3. 1865, Jul. 3.District of Texas. S.O. No. 12, extract 2, s. F. W. Emery.
4. 1865, Jul. 3.District of Texas. S.O. No. 14, extract 1, s. F. W. Emery.
5. 1865, Jul. 3.District of Texas. S.O. No. 14, extract 2, s. F. W. Emery.
6. 1865, Jul. 3.P. H. Sheridan to Gordon Granger. Official copy s. F. W. Emery. Get troops ready for action butddon't provoke hostilities, countermand instructions to FS to seize the Lucy Givin.
7. 1865, Jul. 6.Tomás Mejía to E. B. Brown. LS. Maximilian has ordered him to return the Confederate artillery, etc. to the U.S. troops. In Spanish. Docket: 7/14 ANS of E. B. Brown.
8. 1865, Jul. 6.FS to C. T. Christensen. ADfS. Personal, sorry that Christensen is leaving the army.
9. 1865, Jul. 6.13th Army Corps. S.O. No. 80, extract 1, s. F. W. Emery.
10. 1865, Jul. 7.P. H. Sheridan to FS. ALS. Annoy the French as much as you can.
11. 1865, Jul. 8.War Department - A.G.O. Orinted Circular No. 31. Muster-out. s. R. F. Halsted.
12. 1865, Jul. 8.War Department j]A.G.O. G.O. No. 122. Printed. Regimental officers of Volunteers on detached service.
13. 1865, Jul. 8.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. [358?]. Printed.
14. 1865, Jul. 11.District of Texas. S.O. No. 18, s. F. W. Emery Printed.
15. 1865, Jul. 11.P. H. Sheridan to FS. ES. Remarks and instructions in regard to matters on the Rio Grande.
16. 1865, Jul. 11.War Department - Bureau of Refugees. Printed Circular No. 10, s. Richard A. Kent. Reports.
17. 1865, Jul. 12.War Department - Bureau of Refugees. Printed Circular No. 11, s. R. F. Halsted. Instructions to assistant commissioners and other officers.
18. 1865, Jul. 14.Army of the Rio Grande. G.O. No. 4. Printed, s. J. Lyman. Housing.

19. 1865, Jul. 14.[FS] to P. H. Sheridan. Letter. Progress in annoying the French, Mejia, Foreigh Legion left Matamoros, Kirby Smith and Magruder in Mexico and Shelby, thieves taking stock into Mexico, thinks Mejia will go with strongest side, possible U.S. protectorate of Mexico, Cortina wants muskets to attack Matamoros.
20. 1865, Jul. 14.War Department - Bureau of Refugees. Printed Circular No. 12, s. Richard A. Kent. Sanitary Commission.
21-22. 1865, Jul. 15.dos. F. Fulton to F.S.[sic] Lacey. ALS. Completion of dam at Boca Chica and map.
23. 1865, Jul. 17.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 32. Advertising and job printing.
24. 1865, Jul. 18.John P. Hawkins to FS. ALS. Received Brevet Major General, thanks to FS.
25. 1865, Jul. 19.Army of the Rio Grande. G.O. No. 5. Printed. J. Lyman to replace Lacey.
26. 1865, Jul. 20.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 34, s. [T. W. C. Moore]. General rules.
27. 1865, Jul. 20.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 123. Printed. Authorizations of leaves, etc.
28. 1865, Jul. 20.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 124. Printed, s. E. D. Townsend. 13th and 16th Army Corps discontinued, 13th to be a Division of FS.
29. 1865, Jul. 20.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 125. Printed. Reduce transportation.
30. 1865, Jul. 20.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 126. Printed. Mounted Batteries.
31. 1865, Jul. 20.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. 373. Printed.
32. 1865, Jul. 21.War Department. List of Volunteer Organization Mustered Out. Printed, s. das. McMillan.
33. 1865, Jul. 21.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 127. Printed. Establishes Bureau for collection and safe-keeping and publication of the Rebel Archives.
34. 1865, Jul. 21.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 128. Printed. Cadets appointed in Army of U.S.
35. 1865, Jul. 22.13th Army Corps. S.O. No. 85, extract 1, Printed, s. F. W. Emery. 23rd Iowa Volunteers.
36. 1865, Jul. 22.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 35, s. R. F. Halsted. Muster-out.
37. 1865, Jul. 24.District of Texas. S.O. No. 20, extract 1. Printed, s. F. W. Emery. Board of Examiners for proposed officers of colored regiments.
38. 1865, Jul. 25.P. H. Sheridan to FS. ALS. Cortina may sell captured cotton.
39. 1865, Jul. 25.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 129. Printed. Equal justice and personal liberty for freedmen.
40. 1865, Jul. 27.Army of the Rio Grande. G.O. No. 6. Printed. Re: J. D. Rouse.
41. 1865, Jul. 28.Division of the Gulf. S.O. No. 10, extract 5. Printed. Re: Lacey.
42. 1865, Jul. 28.War Department A.G.O. G.O. No. 130. Printed, stamp of E. D. Townsend. General officers to report, FS and G. A. Custer to repor to H. G. Wright.
43. 1865, Jul. 28.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 131. Printed, s. R. F. Halsted. Army Corps discontinued.
44. 1865, Jul. 31.Army of the Rio Grande. G.O. No. 7. Printed s. J. D. Rouse. R. P. Strong, aide to FS.
Correspondence 1865, August 1-16.
1. 1865, Aug. 1.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 3 Commissaries and assistant commissaries of musters.
2. 1865, Aug. 2.Ths. Mejia to FS. ANS in English. Rumored that Shelby sold arm to the guerillas of Juarez, at Piedras Negras.
3. 1865, Aug. 2.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 3 s. Thomas M. Vincent. Volunteer troops in Texas to be reduced.

4. 1865, Aug. 3.Matamoros, Mexico - Prefecto Politico to [FS?], General in charge of American soldiers in [?]. Letter in Spanish. Cortinas stealing mules and taking them into Texas to sell to U.S. Army.
5. 1865, Aug. 4.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. 399. Printed.
6. 1865, Aug. 6.A. Wood (U.S. Commercial agent in Matamoros) to FS. ANS. Thanks for arrangingsafe conduct to Brazos.
7-8. 1865, Aug. 7.L. Robles (Ministre de Fomento) to FS. ANS in Spanish and typed translation. Re: newspaper Ranchero.
9. [1865, Aug. 7?].P. H. Sheridan to FS. LS. Turning over artillery to Cortinas.

10. 1865, Aug. 7-14.FS - Journal. AD. Brownsville, Texas; describes dinner on 6th with Robles, Mejia, etc. Dangue fever; editor of Ranchero taken to task by Robles; Juarez needs U.S. help; death of N. Lyon at Wilson's Creek; Gov. De Lion; Cortina a murderer, robber, etc. [An undated bill in back pocket of vol. from Henry Welch].
11. 1865, Aug. 7.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. 400. Printed.
12a. 1865, Aug. 8.[FS] to P. H. Sheridan. ADf. Gen. Wright, rebels coming in from Mexico.
12b. 1865, Aug. 9.Division of the Gulf. S.O. No. 21, extract 1, s. Robert Adams, Jr. Orders FS and troops to Texas.
13. 1865, Aug. 9.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. 408. Printed.
14. 1865, Aug. 9.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. 410. Printed.
15. 1865, Aug. 11.Manuel Reyes Apreza to FS. ANS in Spanish.
16-17. 1865, Aug. 11.Juan N. Cortinas to FS. LS in Spanish and translation. Imperial troops on Rio Bravo, fire etc.
18-19. 1865, Aug. 11.Tomas Mejia to FS. LS in Spanish and translation. Cortinas men violating neutrality of border, stealing horses.
20. 1865, Aug. 11.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 40, s. R. F. Halsted.
21-22. 1865, Aug. 13.F. de Leon to FS. ALS in Spanish and translation. Comments on Mexican situation and history, state of Tamaulipas, background of Cortina and his position.
23. 1865, Aug. 13.Western District of Texas. G.O. No. 2. Printed, s. Richard A. Kent. Replaces Rouse.
24-25. 1865, Aug. 14.Matamoros Merchants to FS. DS. Complaints against refuge given bandits, want specie wagons protected. Docket: NS of FS.
26. 1865, Aug. 14.Mr. and Mrs. Nieter to FS. AN. Invitation.
27. 1865, Aug. 15.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 41. Muster out.
28. 1865, Aug. 16.Western District of Texas. G.O. No. 3. Printed, s. Richard A. Kent. Conover.
Correspondence 1865, August 17-30.
1-2. 1865, Aug. 17.Juan N. Cortina to FS. LS in Spanish and translation. Imperial troops on right bank of Rio Bravo, took prisoners.
3. 1865, Aug. 18.War Department - A.G.O. S.O. No. 446, extract 11. Printed, stamped E. D. Townsend. Dunham.
4. 1865, Aug. 18.War Department - A.G.O. S.O. No. 446, extract 19, s. R. F. Halsted.
5. 1865, Aug. 19.Western District of Texas. G.O. No. 4. Printed, s. Richard A. Kent. Rations.
6. 1865, Aug. 19.Frank E. Whitcomb to FS. ALS. A woman caught FS's horse, Seigel in Florida.
7. 1865, Aug. 21.Dept. of Louisiana. S.O. No. 35, extract 6, s/ R. F. Halsted. Leave of absence.
8. 1865, Aug. 21.Western District of Texas. G.O. No. 5. Printed. McEntee relieved.
9a & 9b. 1865, Aug. 22.Dr. Nicolas de Ealo to [FS]. ANS in Spanish with translation. Thanks for passport to New Orleans.
10. 1865, Aug. 22.P. H. Sheridan to FS. LS. Re: Cortina and Mejia.
11. 1865, Aug. 22.P. H. Sheridan to FS. LS. Re: De Leon.
12. 1865, Aug. 24.1st Provisional Division of the Department of Texas. ADfS of FS. G.O. No. [1]. FS takes command, headquarters at Brownsville.
13. 1865, Aug. 24.1st Provisional Division of the Department of Texas. G.O. No. 1. Printed version of #12.
14. 1865, Aug. 24.Mrs. Mary Thompson to FS. ALS. Arkansas woman asks aid.
15. 1865, Aug. 24.Unknown to [FS?]. AD in Spanish. Report of battle at Matamoros won by liberals under Escobedo.
16. 1865, Aug. 24.Western District of Texas. Printed Circular, s. Richard A. Kent. Discontinuing 13th Army Corps.
17. 1865, Aug. 24.Western District of Texas. G.O. No. 6. Printed, s. Richard A. Kent. Rhoades relieved.
18. 1865, Aug. 26.John M. Wilson to FS. ALS. Wants recommendation.
19. 1865, Aug. 29.35th Wisconsin Infantry Volunteers. DS of Geo. H. Walther and David Hunter. Report of Strength.
20. 1865, Aug. 29.35th Wisconsin Infantry Volunteers. Roster. DS of George H. Walther and David Hunter.
21. 1865, Aug. 30.H. M. Porter to Richard A. Kent. NS.
22. 1865, Aug. 30.7th Vermont Volunteer Infantry. Roster DS of H[enry] M. Porter. Enclosed in #21.
23. 1865, Aug. 30.77th Ohio Volunteer Infantry. Report of Strength. DS of Henry L. Pugh and Wm. E. Stevens.
24. 1865, Aug. 30.77th Ohio Volunteer Infantry. Roster. DS of Henry L. Pugh and Wm. E. Stevens.
25. 1865, Aug. 30.34th Indiana Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Roster. DS of Nimrod Headington and T. J. Bowman.
26. 1865, Aug. 30.28th Illinois Infantry Volunteers. Roster. DS of Hinman Rhodes.

1. 1865, Sept. 1.War Department - A.G.O. G.C.M.O. No. 498. Printed, s. Richard A. Kent.
2. 1865, Sept. 4.Thos. T. Eckert to FS. LS. An account of C. C. Bliss of Little Rock for printing for FS.
3. 1865, Sept. 4.Raymond H. Perry to FS. ALS. Wants to join FS's command or fight French.
4. 1865, Sept. 5.Western District of Texas. G.C.M.O. No. 1. Printed. Court martial of Lt. Col. R. G. Morrison.
5. [No document]
6. 1865, Sept. 9.War Department - A.G.O. Printed Circular No. 44. Muster out.

10. 1865, Sept. 10.48th Ohio Veteran Infantry Volunteer Battalion. Tri-monthly Report. DS. of Jas. R. Lynch and Wm. H. H. Rike.
11. 1865, Sept. 10.Mejia Division to [FS]. Printed invitation to attend Mexican Independence Celebration (Sept. 16) in Matamoros.
12. 1865, Sept. 10.7th Massachusetts Battery, Light Artillery. Morning Report. DS of N. W. Storer.

Correspondence 1865, September 11-20.
1. 1865, Sept. 11.Jas. R. Lynch to Richard A. Kent. ANS.
2. 1865, Sept. 12.Andres Trevino to FS. ALS in Spanish. Asks favor or free passage to New Orleans.
3. 1865, Sept. 13.R. M. Bozman to Richard A. Kent. ALS. Re: 29th Illinois Infantry Regiment, personal, women.
4. 1865, Sept. 13.29th Illinois Infantry Veteran Volunteer Regiment. Morning Report. DS of Eli W. Green and R. M. Bozman.
5. 1865, Sept. 16.Baile Nacional en el Teatro de la Reforma [Matamoros]. Printed personal ticket.
6-7. 1865, Sept. 18.Tomas Mejia to FS. LS in Spanish and translation. Deserter from U.S. Army.
8-9. 1865, Sept. 18.Tomas Mejia to FS. LS in Spanish and translation. Has only military authority, cannot handle cotton reclamation.
10. 1865, Sept. 18.H. G. Wright to FS. ALS. Cargo of Compadre, cotton trade.
11. 1865, Sept. 20.48th Ohio Veteran Infantry Volunteers Battalion. Tri-monthly report. DS of Jas. R. Lynch and W. H. H. Rike.
12. 1865, Sept. 20.E. W. Green to R. A. Kent. NS. Sends roster and report of 29th Illinois Infantry.
13. 1865, Sept. 20.John J. Jones to Richard A. Kent. NS.
14. 1865, Sept. 20.46th Illinois Infantry Veteran Volunteers. Morning Report. DS of John J. Jones and Andreas Olnhausen. Enclosed in #13.
15. 1865, Sept. 20.46th Illinois Infantry Veteran Volunteers. Roster. DS of John J. Jones and Andreas Olnhausen. Enclosed in #13.
16. 1865, Sept. 20.[J. L.] Lyon to FS. ALS. French occupation in Monterrey, difficulty for Americans, U.S. should do something.
17. 1865, Sept. 20.7th Massachusetts Battery, Light Artillery. Morning Report. DS of N. W. Storer.
18. 1865, Sept. 20.37th Regiment Illinois Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Tri-monthly report. DS of R. [Kunicott?] and C. B. Chroniger.
19. 1865, Sept. 20.24th Battalion Indiana Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Roster. DS of John P. McCart.
20. 1865, Sept. 20.24th Battalion Indiana Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Tri-monthly report. DS of Wm. S. Pollard and J. P. McCart.
21. 1865, Sept. 20.29th Illinois Infantry. Roster. DS of R. M. Bozman.
Correspondence 1865, September 21-30.
1. 1865, Sept. 21.4th Battery, Light Artillery, Massachusetts Veteran Volunteers. Report of Strength. j DS of Geo. G. Trull.
2. 1865, Sept. 21.Rafael Olvera.to [FS]. Printed invitation to ball in honor of Mejia.
3. 1865, Sept. 21.N. W. Storer to [Richard A. Kent?]. NS. Report of strength of 7th Massachusetts Battery.
4. 1865, Sept. 21.7th Massachusetts Battery. Roster. DS of N. W. Storer. Enclosed in #3.
5. 1865, Sept. 22.Monterrey, Mexico - French Commandante (signature illegible) to FS. LS in French. Col. Whittelsey's visit to Monterrey.
6-7. 1865, Sept. 22.Apolinaria Prado to FS. Letter in Spanish by Francisco Gonzales Rodriguez and translation. Arrest of Sra. Prado's sons, she wishes an investigation, they are innocent.

8. 1865, Sept. 22.P. H. Sheridan. Copy of endorsement on letter of Gen. Slaughter, s. Geo. A. Forsyth. Confederate officers who went into Mexico will be arrested and tried by Military Commission. Re: Gen. Slaughter who sold arms to Imperialist
9. 1865, Sept. 23.[J.] L. Lyons to FS. ALS. French treatment of Americans in Monterrey, McManus in prison.
10. 1865, Sept. 23.E. B. Steele to FS. LS. Sends present.
11-12. 1865, Sept. 24.Juan N. Cortina to FS. LS in Spanish and translation. Claim of an American citizen to some horses and arms.
13. 1865, Sept. 24.Mejia Ball. Printed ticket in cover addressed to FS.
14, 1865, Sept. 26.[?] Wurtembert (Vice Consul of France at Matamoros). DS. Statement of complaint. U.S. soldiers shooting musket balls, etc. at houses across river, fear accident, demand cessation.
15. 1865, Sept. 28.Tomas Mejia to FS. LS in Spanish. Covering letter to #14.
16. 1865, Sept. 30.48th Battalion Ohio Veteran Infantry Volunteers. Return. DS of Jas. R. Lynch and W. H. H. Rike.
17. 1865, Sept. 30.48th Battalion Ohio Veteran Infantry Volunteers. Tri-Monthly Return. DS of Jas. R. Lynch and W. H. H. Rike.
18. 1865, Sept. 30.37th Regiment Illinois Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Descriptive List of Deserters. DS of R. Kennicott and C. B. Chroniger.
19. 1865, Sept. 30.37th Regiment Illinois Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Return. DS of R. Kennicott and C. B. Chroniger.
20. 1865, Sept. 30.37th Regiment Illinois Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Tri-Monthly Report. DS of R. Kennicott and C. B. Chroniger.
21. 1865, Sept. 30.24th Battalion Indiana Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Tri-Monthly Report. DS of Wm. S. Pollard and J. P. McCart.
22. 1865, Sept. 30.Western District of Texas. G.C.M.O. No. 3. Printed, s. Richard A. Kent.
Correspondence 1865, October 4-13.
1. 1865, Oct. 4.Juan N. Cortina to FS. Translation. Re: members and non-members of his brigade.
2. 1865, Oct. 4.[FS] to P. H. Sheridan. ADf. Cannot spare Whittelsey.
3. 1865, Oct. 6.Tomas Mejia to FS. Translation. A reclamation Francisco Balli and E. M. Hamilton.
4. 1865, Oct. 7.Division of the Gulf. S.O. No. 73, extract 10. Printed, s. Robt. Adams, Jr. FS relieved of duty and granted 30 days leave of absence.
5. 1865, Oct. 7.War Department - A.G.O. G.O. No. 143. Printed stamped E. D. Townsend. FS assigned to command Dept. of the Columbia.
6. 1865, Oct. 10.48th Battalion Ohio Veteran Infantry Volunteers. Tri-monthly Report. DS of W. H. H. Rike.
7. 1865, Oct. 10.Ernest Masson to FS. ALS. Had met FS in '48, favors Empire, Railroad to Facubaya, Veracruz Railroad.
8. 1865, Oct. 10.FS to P. H. Sheridan. Copy. Isaac Suratt on his way to Washington for the purpose of Assassinating the President, description of Suratt.
9. 1865, Oct. 10.37th Illinois Veteran Volunteer Infantry. Tri-monthly Report. DS of R. Kennicott and C. B. Chroniger.
10. 1865, Oct. 10.24th Battalion Indiana Infantry Veteran Volunteers. Tri-monthly Report. DS of Wm. S. Pollard and J. P. McCart.
11. 1865, Oct. 11.Division of the Gulf. S.O. No. 76, extract 7. Printed, s. Robt. Adams, Jr. FS's leave cancelled, to go to Ft. Vancouver.
12. 1865, Oct. 12.[J. L.] Lyon to FS. ALS.
13. 1865, Oct. 12.[Luis] Robles to FS. ANS in Spanish. Encloses note of Mr. Masson.
14. 1865, Oct. 12.H. G. Wright to FS. ALS. Re: Stanley, Whittelsey.
15. [1865, Oct. 13?].FS to Andrew Johnson. ADfS of tel. Re: Isaac Surratt, assassination plot.

16. 1865, Oct. 13.FS to P. H. Sheridan. Copy by Richard Kent. Sending dispatches re: Suratt, Cortina's attack on Mejia, Escobedo has received a message from Juarez about Cortina, advocates helping Liberals, injustice.
Correspondence 1865, October 17-31.
1. 1865, Oct. 17.[Tomas Nejia] to FS. Letter in Spanish. The firing from a Mexican house on the Brownsville hospital. Not signed.
2a. and 2b. 1865, Oct. 19.M[ariano] Escobedo to W. R. [sic] Steele (FS). ANS in Spanish and translation. Personal, coming to Matamoros.
3. 1865, Oct. 19.Giles A. Smith to FS. Xeros of LS. Appreciation.
4-5. 1865, Oct. 20.M[ariano] Escobedo to W. R. [sic] S. [ALS] in Spanish and translation. To begin military operations against Matamoros.
6. 1865, Oct. 20.Western District of Texas. G.O. No. 7. Printed. FS relinquishes command.

7. 1865, Oct. 24.G. Garcia et al. to FS. DS in Spanish, signed by members of the Junta Patriotica Mejicana of Brownsville (G. Garcia, Andres Trevino, Man. Saavedral, [?] C. [Boria?], Francisco Gonzales Rodriguez, Alonso Aspi, Juan Francisco Dominguez, Miguel [Tovar], Antonio Zertucha, Francisco de Leon). Thanks FS for his sympathy, justice, hope for armistice.
8. 1865, Oct. 27.F. J. Herron to A. C. Graham. ALS. Introduces FS.
9. 1865, Oct. 31.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Talked to U.S. Grant, FS incurred hostility of Radicals, personal advice, FS's promotion.
Correspondence 1865, November.
1a. 1865, Nov. 14.George Steele to Dear Brother. Xerox of ALS.
1b. 1865, Nov. 15.A. P. Wood to FS. ALS. Writing military history of Iowa, wants FS's record since Colonelcy of 8th Iowa Infantry.
2. 1865, Nov. [16]William B. Astor et al. Printed invitation to Grant Reception on 20th.
3. [1865, Nov. 20].Grant Reception. Printed admission ticket.
4. [1865, Nov. 20].Grant Reception. Printed dinner ticket.

1. 1865, Dec. 6.Brewster & Co. (N.Y.) to FS. Receipted bill for carriage.
2-3. [1865, Dec. 6].Brewster & Co. Lithographs of 2 carriages.
4. 1865, Dec. 9.Headquarters of the Army - A.G.O. S.O. No. 32, extract 1. DS of [R?] Williams. FS may delay going to Dept. of the Columbia.
5. 1865, Dec. 17.W. D. Snow to FS. ALS. Re: Pine Bluff telegraph line.
6. 1865, Dec. [18?].J. W. Nesmith to H[arvey] Hadley. ALS. Introducing FS to a great Horse man.
7. 1865, Dec. 19.Jas. Totten to FS. ALS. Wants recommend for brevet rank.
8. 1865, Dec. 23.H. W. Halleck to E. R. S. Canby. Circular letter, s. C. T. Christensen. Difficulty with Spanish minister Tassara.
9. 1865, Dec. 30.Edw. McK. Hudson to FS. ALS. Recommends Cosmopolitan Hotel in San Francisco.
10. [1865].Alabama River Landings. Holograph list, unsigned.
11-12. [1865].Ambros & Segura to FS. ALS in Spanish and translation. Situation in Mexico, refugees, El Republicano wants payment.

14. [1865].G. [Baturoni]. Justice. Holograph article. Troubles of Mexican editors, imprisonment of D. W. T. Claveran.

16. [1865].11th Illinois Volunteer Infantry. Roster of Commissioned Officers. ADS of James H. Coates.

25. [1865].37th Illinois Infantry. Roster of Commissioned Officers. ADS of Herman Wolferd.

1. 1866, Jan. 4.J. Bidwell to C. J. Brenham. Copy. Re: John Adair, Jr.
2a. 1866, Jan. 24.Ben. H. Brooks to FS. ALS. Family.
2b. 1866, Jan. 24.D. Strong to FS. Tel. Lt. Strong left by Steamer Atlantic on the 11th.

6. 1866, Feb. 16.[R. C. Drune?] to FS. ANS. Invitation to visit Hayward and Easton ranches.
7. 1866, Feb. 24.Dept. of the Columbia. G.O. No. 4. Printed, s. Geo. Williams. FS assumes command, staff.
8. 1866, Mar. 2.Dept. of the Columbia. G.O. No. 5. Printed. s. Geo. Williams. Boise becomes District under Marshall.
9. 1866, Mar. 5.C. C. Andrews to FS. ALS. Wants to be recommended as Col. of one of new regiments.
10. 1866, [Jan. 16].C. C. Andrews. Printed military record. Enclosed in #9.
11. 1866, Mar. 5.Robt. N. Scott to FS. ALS. Re: salute at San Francisco. Puget Sound, Port Townsend, troops on San Juan Island.
12. 1866, Mar. 27.John B. Steele to [FS]. ALS. Personal, FS's position and career, flare-up between radicals and President.
13. 1866, Apr. 4.H. W. Halleck to FS. Copy s. Robert N. Scott. Cavalry, Indian trouble in Goose and Surprise Valleys, general instructions re: Indians, treaties a fraud.
14. 1866, Apr. 5.John B. Steele to FS. ALS. Will send field desk.
15. 1866, Apr. 20.William d Pickering to FS. ALS. Gov's. welcome, wants inspection of military posts on Puget Sound.
16. 1866, Apr. 27.Addison C. Gibbs to FS. ALS. Gov. of Ore. wants muster-out of Oregon volunteers.
Correspondence 1866, May-July.
1. 1866, May 6.A. C. Gibbs to FS. ALS. Politics involved in muster-out of Ore. volunteers.
2. 1866, May 6.C. G. Sawtelle to FS. ALS. One of FS's horses to be sold, Cap, partridge shooting, etc.

3. 1866, May 10.D. W. Ballard to FS. ALS. Political emergency in Ore., Nez Perce restless over delay in payment of annuities. Concurrence s. Thos. Monreith, Walter Monreith, Edward R. Geary, W. A. McPherson, Dennis Bench.

7. 1866, Jun. 23.[George] Stoneman to FS. ALS. Sends clip that could be slanderous.
8. 1866, Jul. 14.H. W. Halleck to FS. Copy s. Richard P. Strong. Ft. Boise useless as a military post, operation in Owyhee Mountains, Indians--Winnemucca and Daulina of Piutes.

10. 1866, Jul. 26.Orville Jennings to FS. ALS. Asks about Cregon country.
11. 1866, Jul. 27.FS to George Steele. ALS. Inspection tour, visit to Victoria, travel through Oregon, Indian trouble.

7. 1866, Sept. 14.Robt. N. Scott to FS. ALS. Re: Pope, etc.

Series I B. Copy books, 1865

arrangement.p: In chronological order by earliest date of volume.

did.unittitle: Copy Book 1865, January 9-October 21.

scopecontent.p: Fair copies signed by various sides or assistant adjutants general: John F. Lacey, Charles T. Scammon, Joseph Lyman, J. D. Rouse, Richard A. Kent, D. J. Wheeler. No index. Move from Kenner, La. to Mobile Point, etc. Move toward Pollard, Ala. P. 61 instructions to Spurling 3/19/65; attack on Blakely and its capture (p. 75-79) and 83-86); report of move to Selma (p. 90); end of war; Rio Grande and Texas; lecters to Sheridan (pp. 105, 111-113, 115-116, 120-121, 127, 132-133, 135, 136-138, 140, 141-142, 152, 155-156); letter to E. B. Brown (p. 119); Ney invasion plan (of Texas, p. 131.); border incidents, Mejia and Cortina, reports to Wright of Western District of Texas (Pp. 164-167); to Wright re: Juarez, etc. (pp. 175-176), letters to Whitteley (pp. 2010203)--Juarez, Cortina, etc.

did.unittitle: Copy Book 1865, March 19-June 1.

scopecontent.p: Letterpress or reverse carbon, many badly faded. No index. Letters by John F. Lacey, FS, Joseph Lyman, Richard A. Kent. Not the same as the letters appearing in Vol. 7. Pensacola Bay Operationsmost written in the field; Spanish Fort reported evacuated 4/1/65 (p. 56); report of skirmish at Wilkin's Plantation and approach on Blakely and battle (p. 55); Montgomery, Ala. and Mobile.

did.unittitle: Series I C. Miscellaneous, 1849-1890

scopecontent.p: Includes printed maps, photographs, prints, scrapbooks, clippings, printed pamphlets.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous

scopecontent.p: Dockets and covers; Studebaker Bros. advertisement; etching by Edson Newell of Green Oaks on card; Lead, S. Dakota, n.d. advertising; holograph list of books; blank Postal letter; Music of the Baker Family (sheet music) (The Wooneac Serenade 1861; Ole Shady or the Song of the Contraband by Hanby (sheet music).

did.unittitle: Maps
1. 1860.Colton's Railroad and Township Map of Arkansas. Printed, very fragile.
2. [1866].Map of the Seat of Conflict. Printed by O. D. Case & Co. Hartford, Conn. In pieces, very fragile.
3. ND. Field of War Operations in the West (Missouri and Arkansas). Printed, Theodore Schrader, St. Louis Mo.
4. ND. California Mail Route west from Ft. Smith, Ark. Printed.
5. [1866].Washington, Oregon and Idaho. Partial xerox copy.
6. ND.Red River Campaign, Arkansas. Traced and compiled by donor's dister.
